Eric Schmidt said the company's`` outlook is bright'' and that his resignation reflects the fact that Google has grown substantially so managing the business has become more complicated under the firm's current triumvirate management structure. executive chairman,`` a lot of my time'' will be devoted to dealing with regulators and other government officials, Eric Schmidt said.`` We've got very complicated government issues,'' he said, adding that we move quickly, and we tend to be disruptive at scale. European Union officials opened a formal antitrust probe last year into Google search results, while in China the company opted to shut down its mainland search engine rather than censor results for user queries.
